docs.snippet: Affairs in the city have undergone little or no change since my last. The work of re-organization is still progressing, but like the growth of plants or the passage of the wind, it is not seen. It is sincerely to be hoped that this time we have a...

headline.main: Affairs in St. Louis Unchanged The Gunboats Progressing The Mortar-Boats Fugitives from Southwest Missouri Movements of Price, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Affairs in the city have undergone little or no change since my last. The work of re-organization is still progressing, but like the growth of plants or the passage of the wind, it is not seen. It is sincerely to be hoped that this time we have a capable chief one of sufficient merit to stand the test of three or six months service.

docs.snippet: When the monastic walls of the Brooklyn Academy of Music were unveiled to the heathen eye of this City, there was a vile architectural scandal that the place when it had done growing would become a church.
docs.lead_paragraph: When the monastic walls of the Brooklyn Academy of Music were unveiled to the heathen eye of this City, there was a vile architectural scandal that the place when it had done growing would become a church.

headline.main: Camp Inspection and the Sanitary Commission.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Sanitary Commission, with questionable zeal and unquestionable taste, has been again disporting itself in the columns of the World, as a rival to the Medical Bureau of the army. For many reasons this ill-advised and eccentric conduct is to be regretted.

docs.snippet: In the midst of unprecedented political troubles we have cause of great gratitude to God for unusual good health and most abundant harvests.

headline.main: PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE.; Follow-Citizens of the Senate and House of Representatives:

docs.lead_paragraph: In the midst of unprecedented political troubles we have cause of great gratitude to God for unusual good health and most abundant harvests.

docs.snippet: The British mail steamship Karnak, from Havana Nov. 23, calling at Nassau Nov. 25, arrived here yesterday morning.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA AND NASSAU.; Arrival of the British Mail Steamship Karnak.

docs.lead_paragraph: The British mail steamship Karnak, from Havana Nov. 23, calling at Nassau Nov. 25, arrived here yesterday morning.
